people.name: Tom Mboya
people.biography: Tom Mboya was a key figure in Kenya's struggle for independence and development. He played a pivotal role in the Airlift Africa program and the formation of KANU.

people.name: Thomas Sankara
people.biography: Thomas Sankara, known as the 'Che Guevara of Africa,' led a revolution in Burkina Faso, promoting self-sufficiency and women's rights.
notable_achievements: Changed the country's name from Upper Volta to Burkina Faso
Promoted women's rights and environmental protection
Advocated for debt cancellation for African nations

people.name: Ronald Ngala
people.biography: Ronald Ngala was a founding member of KADU and a prominent advocate for regionalism and minority rights in post-independence Kenya.
notable_achievements: Founder of the Kenya African Democratic Union (KADU)
Advocated for a federal system in Kenya
Prominent leader in Kenya's early politics

people.name: Nelson Mandela
people.biography: Nelson Mandela was a key figure in the fight against apartheid and became South Africa's first black president in 1994.
notable_achievements: Awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993
First black President of South Africa
